PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Broad absorption , appropriate HOMO / LUMO positions , and comparable hole mobility make PSFDTBT a promising donor material in BHJ PSCs.

Let's think step by step.

1. Broad absorption: This term refers to the ability of a material to absorb a wide range of light wavelengths. In this context, it can be considered as a property of the material PSFDTBT.
2. Appropriate HOMO / LUMO positions: HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) and LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) are electronic properties of a material. In this context, they are properties of the material PSFDTBT that make it a promising donor material.
3. Comparable hole mobility: Hole mobility is a measure of how easily holes (positive charge carriers) can move through a material. In this context, it is a property of the material PSFDTBT that is comparable to other materials used in BHJ PSCs (Bulk Heterojunction Perovskite Solar Cells).
4. PSFDTBT: This is the name of the material being discussed in the paragraph. It is a donor material in BHJ PSCs.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. Broad absorption: This is a property of the material PSFDTBT.
2. Appropriate HOMO / LUMO positions: HOMO and LUMO are electronic properties of the material PSFDTBT.
3. Comparable hole mobility: This is a property of the material PSFDTBT.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Broad absorption |
| Appropriate HOMO / LUMO positions |
| Comparable hole mobility |
| of the material PSFDTBT |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Broad absorption , appropriate HOMO / LUMO positions , and comparable hole mobility make PSFDTBT a promising donor material in BHJ PSCs.

Let's think step by step.

1. Broad absorption: This term refers to the ability of a material to absorb a wide range of light wavelengths. In this context, it can be considered as a property related to the material's optical absorption characteristics.
2. Appropriate HOMO / LUMO positions: HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) and LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) are energy levels in a molecule. The appropriate positions of these energy levels in relation to each other and to the energy levels of other materials are important properties for determining the material's ability to donate or accept electrons in a junction, such as in a bulk heterojunction (BHJ) solar cell.
3. Comparable hole mobility: Hole mobility is a measure of how easily holes (positive charge carriers) can move through a material. In the context of the paragraph, it is mentioned as a property of PSFDTBT that makes it a promising donor material in BHJ PSCs, implying that it has comparable hole mobility to other materials used in the solar cell.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. Broad absorption: This refers to the material's optical absorption characteristics.
2. Appropriate HOMO / LUMO positions: These are energy levels in the material that determine its ability to donate or accept electrons in a junction.
3. Comparable hole mobility: This is a measure of how easily holes can move through the material.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| Broad absorption (optical absorption characteristics) |
| Appropriate HOMO / LUMO positions (energy levels in the material) |
| Comparable hole mobility (measure of how easily holes can move through the material) |
